_description.purpose: Centralized docstring definitions for automated documentation management

usage.how_it_works: This file defines docstrings that are automatically injected into Python functions via the insert_docstrings.py script
usage.hook_integration: The UserPromptSubmit hook in .claude/settings.json runs the script on every user query to keep docstrings synchronized

file_structure.keys: File paths (relative to project root) containing functions to document
file_structure.values: Objects mapping function/method names to their docstrings
file_structure.class_methods: Use 'ClassName.method' syntax for methods within classes

usage.adding_functions: To add new functions, edit this file with 'filename': {'function_name': 'docstring content'}
usage.synchronization: Changes to this file will be automatically applied to target Python files on the next user query

runtime/models/utils.py.get_db:
Get database instance from current context or app module.

Works in both application runtime and test contexts.

Returns:
    Database instance
runtime/models/utils.py.get_or_404:
Get model instance by ID or abort with 404.

Args:
    model: Emmett Model class
    record_id: Primary key value
    
Returns:
    Model instance
    
Raises:
    404 if not found
runtime/models/utils.py.user_has_permission:
Check if user has a specific permission.

Args:
    user_id (int): User ID
    permission_name (str): Permission name (e.g., 'post.create')
    
Returns:
    bool: True if user has the permission
runtime/models/utils.py.user_can_access_resource:
Check if user can access a resource with a specific action.
Supports ownership-based permissions.

Args:
    user_id (int): User ID
    resource (str): Resource name (e.g., 'post')
    action (str): Action name (e.g., 'edit', 'delete')
    instance: Optional resource instance to check ownership
    scope (str): 'own', 'any', or 'both'
    
Returns:
    bool: True if user can access the resource
